intro: Chironia angularis, commonly known as the angular chironia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, branched stems. Its small white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
